result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:15 AM Defendant John Walter Mueller II in court.  Attorney Stephen Eric Mays appeared by video for John Walter Mueller II.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Through Counsel DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.

DEF to post $500 today 4/6/22 and DEF must post $250 by Friday, 4/8/22 at 4pm.  

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. 11:08AM DEF John W. Mueller in court, appearing by video from in custody in Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Gabriel Pollak (special appearance) appearing by video.  Jennifer Gross appearing for the State of WI.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  DEF does not qualify for public defender appointment.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Pollak argues bond.  Court sets bond.  Court gives the DEF the attorney colloquy. Court sets initial appearance for 5/17/22 at 8:30AM.
